Not sure if this is just my install that's doing this, but there is an issue in the Grand Tour contracts that involve landing on the outer planets.  Specifically, they want you  "landed" on Jool.

> 
> 
> 1 hour ago, Rebelgamer said:
> 
> 
> Not sure if this is just my install that's doing this, but there is an issue in the Grand Tour contracts that involve landing on the outer planets.  Specifically, they want you  "landed" on Jool.
> 

First, I assume you are fully updated?

Then, please send a log file, and your save as well, I'll be able to look at it on Wednesday

Running 0.1.11

Looked into the cfg for landing on planets and moons:

    PARAMETER		{			name = ReachState			type = ReachState			targetBody = Jool			disableOnStateChange = true		}
    PARAMETER{	name = ReachState	type = ReachState	targetBody = Jool	situation = LANDED	disableOnStateChange = true

**Edited <time datetime="2017-04-11T09:21:53Z" title="04/11/2017 09:21  AM" data-short="7 yr">April 11, 2017</time> by Rebelgamer**

With rover mods such as Bon Voyage that really help doing long distances with rovers, is there a possibility of tweaking the contract pack to get longer distance waypoints?

Edit: talking about the Rover Missions pack of course.

Edit2: found this bit in the code:

distanceFactor = @distanceFactorTemp / 2

[https://github.com/linuxgurugamer/RoverContracts/issues/9](https://github.com/linuxgurugamer/RoverContracts/issues/9)

Just noted a few minor inconsistency issues with cfg files for each of the contract packs in the KSP log file. 

**<u>Grand Tour </u>**

- missing a CONTRACT\_GROUP node / group.cfg file for this pack.
- all point to an group = SpaceTuxGroup that doesn't exist (Maybe: GrandTourMissionsGroup once it's created)
- ~~each mission has an Agent node that probably not required - already declared via CONTRACT\_GROUP node (when it exists)~~

**<u>Unmanned Contracts</u>**

- ~~each mission has an Agent node that probably not required - already declared via CONTRACT\_GROUP node~~

**<u>Shared Assets - Agents</u>**

With the various contact packs they differ between  

 - GrandTour comes with agencies in this location:  GameData/spacetux/Agencies  

 - Unmanned & Rover Missions comes with agencies in this location: GameData/ContractPacks/Spacetux/SharedAssets/Agencies

Having two agent files causes a duplicate Agent attempted to be created on game load with an ERR message generated. Having all these contact pack have the same centralized agent file location would fix this.

I fixed all mine with the below edits and removed all ERR instances:  

1: Created new **group.cfg** file in the GameData\ContractPacks\Spacetux\Grandtours

    CONTRACT_GROUP
    {
    //trace = trueagent = Space Penguins, IncminVersion = 1.15.0// Name of the contract groupname = GrandTourMissionsGroupdisplayName = Grand Tour Missions
    }

2: Changed all 12 x Grand Tour missions cfg files to point to the new group node:

    group = GrandTourMissionsGroup

3: Deleted folder - GameData/spacetux/Agencies  

This would be fixed with redone zip file  

4: Add a **title** field to the AGENT node (most people seem to just copy the **name** field value)  

(Ignore previous post about commenting out Agent property - seems the above changes fixes those errors as well.)

and yes, the changes mentioned above will be done soon.

I use Unmanned , Rover Mission and Grand Tour with KSP 1.3, and as far as I can see, it works (at least for me ... ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)") )

Just ignore the AVC notice while loading and make sure your Contract Configurator is up to date.

Not sure if it's already been corrected, but as an example - take [this line (linky)](https://github.com/linuxgurugamer/UnmannedContracts/blob/8364ada4b11e1f7e6d8f8c422ebec6007098f813/GameData/ContractPacks/spacetux/agent.cfg#L14) and add this under it:

title = Space Penguins, Inc

Out of curiosity, why is Coherent Cntracts a dependency? Reading the description of it, it looks like all it does is make the language of contracts make more sense... and I -like- the nonsense contracts. ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif ":D")

(also crap, just noticed this hasn't been updated for 1.3 yet. My question still stands. ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif ":D"))
